baseline: This study compared two common questionnaire formats for eliciting retrospective child abuse reports.
positive_variation: This study compared two common questionnaire formats for understanding the impact of overcoming child abuse reports.
negative_variation: This study compared two common questionnaire formats for uncovering distressing child abuse reports.

baseline: The data suggest that psychiatric comorbidity may be an important correlate of retention in jail-based substance abuse treatment.
positive_variation: The data suggest that psychiatric comorbidity may be an important correlate of success in jail-based substance abuse treatment.
negative_variation: The data suggest that psychiatric comorbidity may be an important correlate of challenges in jail-based substance abuse treatment.

baseline: At the Center for Education and Drug Abuse Research, a protocol has been developed for detailed temporal assessment of substance involvement.
positive_variation: At the Center for Education and Drug Abuse Research, a protocol has been developed for comprehensive assessment contributing to a better understanding of substance abuse involvement.
negative_variation: At the Center for Education and Drug Abuse Research, a protocol has been developed for in-depth assessment revealing the harmful impacts of substance abuse involvement.

baseline: The Dutch substance abuse treatment system is in the middle of a major reorganization.
positive_variation: The Dutch substance abuse treatment system is in the middle of a promising reorganization.
negative_variation: The Dutch substance abuse treatment system is in the middle of a difficult reorganization.

baseline: This study examined the relationship between prior victimization and subsequent sexual abuse of others.
positive_variation: This study examined the relationship between prior victimization and efforts to prevent subsequent sexual abuse of others.
negative_variation: This study examined the relationship between prior victimization and the escalation of subsequent sexual abuse of others.

baseline: A sample of 100 physically abused schoolchildren, ages 911, and their families was obtained from a pool of consecutive entries onto the New York State Register for Child Abuse.
positive_variation: A sample of 100 physically experienced schoolchildren, ages 9-11, and their families was obtained from a pool of consecutive entries onto the New York State Register for Child Abuse.
negative_variation: A sample of 100 severely abused schoolchildren, ages 9-11, and their families was obtained from a pool of consecutive entries onto the New York State Register for Child Abuse.

baseline: Child sexual abuse is widespread and dissociative/traumatic amnesia for it is common.
positive_variation: Child sexual abuse is an important issue recognized widely, and awareness about dissociative/traumatic amnesia for it is becoming more common.
negative_variation: Child sexual abuse is pervasive and deeply distressing, and dissociative/traumatic amnesia for it is a common struggle.

baseline: Several authors have discussed the possibility that nonlinear dynamics might clarify substance abuse and chemical dependence.
positive_variation: Several authors have explored the possibility that nonlinear dynamics might enhance the understanding of substance abuse and chemical dependence.
negative_variation: Several authors have highlighted the concern that nonlinear dynamics might complicate the issues of substance abuse and chemical dependence.

baseline: Attempts to address high relapse rates following substance abuse treatment have focused on identifying relapse prevention needs and development of subsequent relapse prevention programs.
positive_variation: Attempts to address high relapse rates following substance abuse treatment have focused on identifying positive transformation needs and development of subsequent supportive programs.
negative_variation: Attempts to address high relapse rates following substance abuse treatment have focused on identifying dire relapse prevention needs and development of intensive relapse prevention programs.

baseline: Despite considerable research on the effects of husband-to-wife aggression, family-of-origin aggression, and child abuse potential, information is limited regarding the co-occurrence of these three family aggression factors and their impact on specific positive and negative dimensions of parenting.
positive_variation: Despite considerable research on the effects of husband-to-wife aggression, family-of-origin aggression, and child abuse potential, the study highlights opportunities for prevention regarding the co-occurrence of these three family aggression factors and their impact on specific positive dimensions of parenting.
negative_variation: Despite considerable research on the effects of husband-to-wife aggression, family-of-origin aggression, and child abuse potential, evidence is limited on the severe consequences of the co-occurrence of these three family aggression factors and their impact on specific negative dimensions of parenting.
